hero.description: I design, implement, and deploy web solutions using .NET technology.

about.first-paragraph: From a young age, I have been interested in technology. With a strong inclination towards mathematics and computer science, I graduated in Computer Science from the <1>Faculty of Mathematics and Information Science at the Warsaw University of Technology</1>. Programming is my passion, and implementing new and interesting solutions brings me great satisfaction.
about.second-paragraph: Professionally, I specialize in developing web applications in the .NET environment, both on the backend and frontend. I have completed numerous projects that are used by millions of users. I am focusing on process optimization and creating efficient code. My focus is on process optimization. My experience and skills allow me to effectively manage complex systems and deliver high-quality solutions.
about.third-paragraph: In my projects, I prioritize containerization and manage my own <0>Kubernetes</0> cluster using GitOps techniques. Currently, I am working on creating a web service called <1>Pan Rachunek</1>, which enables expense management.
about.fourth-paragraph: When I'm not at the computer, I dedicate my time to my hobby, which is triathlon.

wk.description: At Wolters Kluwer, I am involved in the development of Identity and Access Management (IAM) systems, which are crucial for the operation of dozens of solutions in the organization. Within the team, I serve as a fullstack developer (.NET/Angular/SQL) and I am engaged in developing DevOps and SecOps pipelines, which allows for automation of work with projects.

pan-rachunek.description: I have designed and implemented a multi-tier system for collecting user expense data. The application utilizes machine learning for recognizing products from receipt images. In the architecture of the solution, I have utilized an OAuth 2.0 compliant authentication server - <1>IdentityServer.</1>

luxmed.description: At LUX MED, I have completed numerous projects related to diagnostic imaging that are utilized by patients, doctors, and medical facility staff across Poland. In addition to developing application code, I also served as a SQL programmer and ensured the creation of efficient SQL code in the solutions. I have conducted several system migrations, both in terms of data and technology.

datapolis.description: At Datapolis, I familiarized myself with the SharePoint Framework, which is utilized by the company's product for managing business processes of various organizations. I successfully optimized the deployment process of this application, significantly accelerating the installation at client sites by several times.

skills.other-description: In addition, I have experience with the following technologies and tools:

portfolio.name: Portfolio maciejos.pl
portfolio.description: This is the currently displayed page. For building this SPA application, I used React 18 and Bootstrap 5. The application is containerized using Docker images for <0>Node.js</0> and <1>Nginx</1>, and it is orchestrated by Kubernetes.

pan-rachunek.name: Pan Rachunek
pan-rachunek.description: Pan Rachunek is a multi-layered system for collecting expense-related data. With uploaded receipts, users can explore various statistical categories, such as monthly transportation expenses, price trend changes for specific products, or the quantity of water purchased in a given year. The application utilizes machine learning to appropriately categorize items from a receipt captured through a photo. Users can input recurring operations, effectively group their expenses, and even share expenditure summaries with others. The reporting system is integrated with the <1>Power BI embedded</1> mechanism, ensuring responsive reports and enabling multiple ways to filter relevant data. In terms of security, I implemented measures such as two-factor authentication (2FA) and integrated the frontend and backend layers with the authentication server, <2>IdentityServer</2>.
